case_vignette: A 7-year-old healthy boy is brought to the dermatology clinic by his parents after having had a 3-week history of a rash! The patient’s rash was slightly pruritic, and it involved predominantly the trunk, starting as one larger pink patch with fine scale and subsequently spreading with smaller similar macules and patches! The boy’s palms and soles were spared of the rash!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a slightly itchy rash on my trunk that started with one large pink patch and then spread to smaller similar spots, but my palms and soles don't have the rash.
How long ago did the rash start?
The rash started 3 weeks ago.
Have you experienced any recent illnesses or infections, such as a sore throat or fever, prior to the rash appearing?
No, I haven't experienced any recent illnesses or infections before the rash appeared.
Have you taken any new medications, or been exposed to any new products such as detergents, soaps, or cosmetics before the rash started?
No, I haven't taken any new medications or been exposed to new products like detergents, soaps, or cosmetics before the rash started.
Do you have any history of skin conditions or allergies in your family?
Yes, I am generally healthy and there is no history of skin conditions or allergies in my family.
Final Diagnosis: Pityriasis Rosea
